caption: Super cool bartender, a cocktail list soo cool I couldn't decide which one to get and delicious food with flavors we haven't had elsewhere
Awesome. Hits the spot every time!
Great tacos and tapas. Killer cocktails. It’s a great spot.
Amazing service. Great food and great drinks.
Just cool

Ordered from seamless and the food was incredible. Always wanted to check this place out and am glad I got to try it. Tamales were probably some of the best I’ve had! Will most definitely order again. Thanks for everything!
Wait an hour for tasteless food.
The food is amazing!!
Great, flavorful food. Reasonably priced. Cool vibe.
Excellent food and nice atmosphere.
Great drinks!
La Loba it’s a very nice and chill out place, great beer, mezcal and the food is great. The tlayudas are highly recommended! Enjoy there!
It's an okay Mexican restaurant. Loved the mixed drinks
Quiet little lounge brand Mexican food

The owners of this place are dope to the max! They took the time to teach my date and me about mezcal. My next trip will definitely be to Oaxaca. Great food, drinks and ambience. Get the Bird’s Eye cocktail.
Owner of this establishment is extremely rude
Had ok food. Miss Cali though
Terrific cocktails - the Mezcal Penicillin is gold.  Great interior and vibe. Haven't tried the food yet but will return to check it out.
Nice ambiance but the bartender must learn about customer service .

I come here all the time. Please stick around and keep up the good work of being a lovely neighborhood spot. The space is chill, and the food is solid and cocktails are top notch (also I shazam a lot when i visit).

Bartender was not welcoming and on his phone. The place was empty. We walked in and there was no one around but the bartender so we approached the bar and waited for him to get off his phone. He then told us to sit wherever and brought us a water pitcher with stacked cups. He didnt even bother to pour the water. He proceeded to get back on his phone. We reviewed the very small menu and after a while of no one coming to take our order, we got up and left. No apologies for the horrible customer service. The menus on the table were dirty and the furniture was uncomfortable. Maybe if they improve these things and train their staff, I'd go back. But, there's other good food in the area to bother.
Great food. Nice cocktails. Pleasant seating out back.

Every piece of the puzzle was stellar.  Drinks were top notch, salsa was fresh and flavorful, chips were made in house, and the tacos we're simple but authentic.  Would highly recommend the tinga de pollo.  Coming from Texas this is the first place I've found in NY that does it right
Testy food collection
I can't get enough tlayuda! Good cocktails too.
Nice bar!
Delicious food & drinks, topped off with a cool interior!
Lovely interior , I love the decorations.
Food is super tasty, staff attentive, vibe unpretentious and chill.. One of my favorite spots for Mexican yummies.
Amazing food!
3 stars for decent drinks and really cute interior design, but the bartender was rude, ruined the vibe for me.

This used to be my favorite bar, not just in Brooklyn, but in the world. Up there with the Brooklyn bests like the Bearded Lady, the Post Office, city-haunts like Bathtub Gin and PDT, La Loba outshone them all. They boast an incredible selection of cocktails, friendly staff and bartenders, excellent decor, they always play fantastic music, have reasonable prices, and are the closest quality cocktail bar to south Brooklyn.  All that's changed. I've been going to La Loba Cantina for about four years. I no longer live locally in Brooklyn, but I come once or twice a year to visit family. When I would come back - I would always go to La Loba. However, the last few times I'd been going, I'd noticed a change. Staff were no longer as friendly and down-to-earth. A sense of entitlement had settled over the place. But I was able to ignore this, given all the other amazing qualities of, as I said, my once favorite bar in the world. However, my last experience at La Loba was the final nail in the coffin.  I was at La Loba Saturday evening March 23rd with two friends. It took a solid 30 - 40 minutes for the waitress to take our order. The place was crowded, it's a Saturday night, and it turns out it was the first night on the job for our waitress (whose stone face belied a soul), so we let this slide. We ultimately passed a great evening at La Loba, spending nearly four hours there.  The next morning, I see that I have an email from my credit card company indicating there was a fraud alert on my account. I see that I have an additional $225.42 charge to my credit card. I immediately call the credit card company (at this point I also realize I’d left my card at La Loba), to put a hold on my card, but agree to try to sort this issue with La Loba prior to disputing the charge.  What followed was a 72-hour wild goose chase, in which, after speaking with two different individuals on four occasions (one in person) on separate days, no one was able to tell me where this charge came from, or to reimburse me. The mythical manager, the only person who could reimburse me for this charge, did not show up the following Sunday or Monday night. I was told that she would reach out to me after I left my contact information, but she never contacted me. Ultimately it turned out, as I discovered three days later, that our waitress had erroneously charged my credit card for $225.42, a mistake she immediately rescinded (as indicated by the time stamp of the credit, which, nonetheless, was not visible on my credit card account for another three days). Despite the fact that this problem was caused (and resolved) the very same evening (Saturday), no one was able to tell me this, until it was made apparent on my credit card account three days later. And yet, I needed to spend three days following up on this issue, which should have never even been an issue, while being ignored and disrespected throughout.  There are hundreds of bars in Brooklyn. There is even a local bar on the same block (Hinterlands), and two blocks down, east of Coney Island Avenue, there is Wheated, which has an amazing whiskey selection, an excellent cocktail selection, and great food. While I will miss my favorite bar, and the mezcal selection – there are other mezcal bars in the city (try Chavela’s on Franklin Avenue) where one does not need to be treated like vermin by a staff of entitled curmudgeons.  If you do decide to go to La Loba (for their excellent cocktails), then I hope that you have a better experience than I have had. However, I’d like it even more if you decided to take your business elsewhere, in the hopes that they learn a valuable lesson: good cocktails need to be made and served by someone, and if that someone is a miserable wretch, they simply don’t taste as good.
Small portions but delicious. Bartenders are nice 😋🦉

Hate to leave a bad review. I used to like this place. Current bar dude is horrible. Rude, unhelpful, you name it. Really doesn’t give a f#%*. The bar woman however has been fine in the past. The mezcal selection is wide but overpriced—good luck getting the barman to give recommendations. He’ll just point you to the list. Food has always been bland and insubstantial. Wish they would just serve everything in a glass instead of the gimmicky bowls.
Authentic Mexican, great mezcal-based drinks
Super cute spot with unique interior design. Good drinks but food was so disappointing.
Mezcals, Mezcals, Mezcals. Learned some stuff. Informative barkeep.
Been here quite often with my girl. Great place for a date and the food is delicious. There is also a bar.
Really enjoyed the food here .lots of mezcal can be found at this place. Nice neighborhood spot . Food tastes real nice. Fresh  and flavorful
Fantastic Oaxacan Mexican fare with a almost bewildering assortment of mezcal. Memorable meal. Recommended.

The food is good, it has a good flavor and the portions are reasonable. The place is small, and there is not to much space to sit down, the tables are old and uncomfortable. They should improve the furniture.
(Translated by Google) Ricooo  (Original) Ricooo
This place is phenomenal! Drinks are perfectly made to the last sip. Great beer selection as well.

Small and cozy, this spot definitely is all about the drinks with an extensive Mezcal menu, but the smaller bites offered are pretty good. Even the larger entrees are smaller but it's actually a perfect portion unless you're starving. The menu is pretty small itself with variations of the same meat or veggies options available across quesadillas or tacos. Loved the spicy watermelon margarita.  The seats are so uncomfortable and kids can be there, but worth a visit.

I went on a Tuesday night. The food was good, but the kitchen and service were so slow. Ordering was done at the bar. When I asked for a little bit of sour cream, I was charged $1.50 for a couple tablespoons. I may order out from here, but I won't be going back.

Food was good, portions were ridiculously small for being Mexican food. The pozole soup was very tasty, but $8.00 for a  cup is just ridiculous. Had the Cochinita de Pibil, which was ok. Guac was ok, too.  Service was on the blah side. No reason to visit again.
Tequila bar and restaurant. Nice cozy setting, the food portions are small tho.
A great place to day drink, great for groups and great atmosohere!
Decent happy hour, good service . Food was good and spicy. I just wish they had more food options available.

Great food and ambiance. I don't normally comment on service as that can be subjective, but the bartender tonight bordered on hostile. Still, we had an excellent meal and the drinks are worth going back for. I had the El Viejo, a mezcal-based old fashioned, which was a bit sweet but entirely delicious. When my friend asked what beer was on tap the bartender said "Read the menu" (the menu said "ask your server"). There's more I could complain about, but suffice to say, don't let the possibility of inhospitable service deter you from this charming, authentic-feeling cantina with excellent homemade food and a pleasant (really) DIY vibe.

My fiancé and I were visiting family up in Brooklyn and decided to stop in for some good authentic food as we had been reminiscing on our trip to Mexico last summer. We were not disappointed. The food was amazing and the service was outstanding. Our bartender, Jewls, was witty, attentive and quick to answer any questions we had. I would highly recommend stopping by for some good food or to just sit at the bar for some great drinks and service

Great place and atmosphere for a Wednesday night. We tried the pork tacos and guacamole was amazing. The bartender was awesome. She suggested a drink called Lady Xoc Swizzle and let us try the the Sotol that goes in the drink. Definitely recommend going for good food and the best drinks.

I'm from California, where Mexican food is pretty ubiquitous. I thought I knew what Mexican food was, but I was wrong. The food, the atmosphere, the service, and the mescal make La Loba a place to remember. The mescal is delicious - smooth and comforting. La Loba has a kind of neighborhood vibe that makes you instantly feel comfortable and welcome when walking inside. It's a special place.
Drinks are pretty consistent. Good enough for this old Marine.
Best Margaritas and guac. Just a shame that with time the guac portion has diminished. Keep it up, you're a treasure in the neighborhood
Very chill spot, amazing food, great friendly staff, limited but nice beer selection (and tons of tequila-like booze, not my thing so I can’t speak to that).
Best (off menu) margaritas in Brooklyn. Food is great, ambiance takes you away and amazing drinks.
Very nice selection of drinks. Friendly staff. The food selection is a bit limited.
Nice cozy local cantina spot with a great selection of Mezcals and some tasty guacamole.
Forget the amazing wall of Mezcal. They have the best playlist of any bar/restaurant in NYC!
The waterbugs are faster to take your order then the waitress.Drinks are fabolous but besides the guacamole it's like eating cardboard wrapped in a tortilla.
Love this place!  Food, drinks and staff all rock!

Today I was disappointed, today I walked in with my mother treating her for dinner. As we walked in, we waited for 10 minutes and the waitress saw us standing there, and kept walking towards the bar O assumed she was getting us the menu, but I was wrong she took another five minutes long and did not bring us a menu we ended up leaving. We felt like we were being ignored. To me it is embarrasing to bragg about how good the place is when I frequently dine at this location. And I do not say that the restaurant itself is bad. But the new staff is lacking on customer service.

A great neighborhood spot. They have very tasty mexican food (not TexMex, but proper mexican food).  The drinks are creative, tasty, and mezcal forward in a very good way.  The decor isn't going to blow your socks off, but if you have a couple of drinks and the chicharrones I don't think you'll care much.
Delicious food. Excellent staff. Decent prices, particularly considering New York loves to overcharge for mediocre Mexican food. This. Is not mediocre. Love the chill vibe too.
For most all curiosities of Mexican fermentation,   La Loba will quench one's thirst. An excellent selection and knowledgeable staff make it one special agave!
Amazing food and cocktails. Worth going out of the way for!
They make the best guacamole and margaritas in town!!! It's just a shame that over time, the size of the guacamole has diminished. Keep up the good vibe!
Amazing cocktails, an extensive selection of mezcal, great food, and possibly my favorite guacamole ever.
If you don't yet know you love mezcal, this place will help you find out. Really great food and vibes too. Love it here.
Bartender was super friendly. We got a mezcal flight and a chorizo flatbread thing, both of which were great. I would love to go here again.
Everything is amazing from the staff to the food and drinks

La Loba is my favorite bar in the area. Great Oaxaca style Mexican food and the best mezcal cocktails anywhere. All the food and drinks have authentic fresh ingredients. Try the mezcal mule which has amazing fresh ginger juice in it. Crazy good. Lindsey is an amazing bartender and a mezcal authority.
Great fresh flavors and a tasty classic margarita. Would like to see more dinner options though, otherwise a great addition to the neighborhood.

Great mescal selection and cool vibe. Worst Oaxacan street food, I never had a cold and tasteles quesadilla my girlfriend had a dry and flat tlayuda. I've lived in DF and been in Oaxaca and here in NYC many years. Eat before coming for drinks.

Gorgeous, super chill atmosphere with traditional Oaxacan street food, weekly specials & events, and TONS OF AGAVE SPIRITS. This mezcal bar is the closest thing to actually visiting Oaxaca in all of NYC. A sanctuary for any mezcólatras finding themselves in New York.
Cocktails on point!

Great mezcal bar with delicious Oaxacan food. They have a pretty large selection of mezcal and tequila, along with cocktails and margaritas. The food is light and fresh. Atmosphere is great—feels like a small cafe in Mexico. They're adding outdoor space soon.
The Mezcal mule was awesome.
delicious mezcal cocktails.
Cool new spot with a fun vibe, awesome food, and a top notch agave selection. Hot bartenders.
